By means of read magic, the caster can decipher magical inscriptions or runes, as follows:
‚ñ∂ Scrolls: The magical script of a scroll of arcane spells can be understood. The caster is then able to activate the scroll at any time in the future.
‚ñ∂ Spell books: A spell book written by another arcane spell caster can be deciphered.
‚ñ∂ Inscriptions: Runes or magical words inscribed on an object or surface can be understood.
‚ñ∂ Reading again: Once the caster has read a magical inscription using read magic, they are thereafter able to read that particular writing without recourse to the use of this spell.

MagicUser.Name: Shield
MagicUser.Description:
Creates an invisible field of force that gives the caster an improved AC:
‚ñ∂ Against missile attacks: AC 2 [17].
‚ñ∂ Against other attacks: AC 4 [15].

MagicUser.Name: Sleep
MagicUser.Description:
A sleep spell causes a magical slumber to come upon creatures, excluding the undead. The spell may target either:
1. A single creature with 4+1 HD (see Hit point modifiers under Game Statistics in Classic Fantasy: Monsters).
2. A total of 2d8 Hit Dice of creatures of 4 HD or lower each.
When targeting creatures of 4 HD or less, the following rules apply:
‚ñ∂ Weakest first: Targets with the least HD are affected first.
‚ñ∂ HD: Treat monsters with less than 1 HD as having 1 HD and monsters with a fixed hit point bonus as having the flat HD. (For example, a 3+2 HD monster would be treated as having 3 HD.)
‚ñ∂ Excess: Rolled Hit Dice that are not sufficient to affect a creature are wasted.
Killing: Creatures enchanted by this spell are helpless and can be killed instantly with a bladed weapon.
Awakening: Slapping or wounding awakens an affected creature.

MagicUser.Name: Ventriloquism
MagicUser.Description: The caster may make their voice appear to come from any location or source (e.g. a statue or animal) within range.

MagicUser.Name: Continual Light
MagicUser.Description:
This spell has three usages:
1. Conjuring light: In a 30‚Äô radius. The magical light is sufficient for reading, but is not as bright as daylight. The spell may be cast upon an object, in which case the light moves with the object.
2. Blinding a creature: By casting the spell upon its eyes. If the target fails a saving throw versus spells, it is blinded. A blind creature cannot attack.
3. Cancelling darkness: Continual light may cancel a continual darkness spell.
Reversed: Continual Darkness
Creates a 30‚Äô radius area of magical blackness, preventing both normal sight and infravision. Light sources brought within the area of darkness do not illuminate it. Like continual light, it may alternatively be used to blind creatures or to dispel a continual light spell.

MagicUser.Name: Continual Darkness
MagicUser.Description:
Creates a 30‚Äô radius area of magical blackness, preventing both normal sight and infravision. Light sources brought within the area of darkness do not illuminate it. Like continual light, it may alternatively be used to blind creatures or to dispel a continual light spell.
Reversed: Continual Light
This spell has three usages:
1. Conjuring light: In a 30‚Äô radius. The magical light is sufficient for reading, but is not as bright as daylight. The spell may be cast upon an object, in which case the light moves with the object.
2. Blinding a creature: By casting the spell upon its eyes. If the target fails a saving throw versus spells, it is blinded. A blind creature cannot attack.
3. Cancelling darkness: Continual light may cancel a continual darkness spell.

MagicUser.Name: Detect Evil
MagicUser.Description:
Objects enchanted for evil purposes or living beings with evil intentions are caused to magically glow.
‚ñ∂ Intent only: This spell does not grant the ability to read minds, but only grants a general sense of evil intent.
‚ñ∂ Definition of evil: The referee must decide what is ‚Äúevil‚Äù. Some things that are potentially harmful, like traps, are not ‚Äúevil.‚Äù

MagicUser.Name: Detect Invisible
MagicUser.Description: Invisible creatures or items in range are revealed to the caster.

MagicUser.Name: ESP
MagicUser.Description:
This spell grants the caster the ability to perceive and understand the thoughts of other living creatures.
‚ñ∂ Focus for 1 turn: To pick up thoughts, the caster must focus their concentration in one direction for one turn.
‚ñ∂ After this turn: The thoughts of all creatures within range in that direction can be perceived.
‚ñ∂ Multiple creatures: If multiple creatures are within the range in the direction being focused on, their thoughts mingle into a confusing jumble. The caster must spend an additional turn to sort out one creature‚Äôs thoughts.
‚ñ∂ Meaning: The caster understands the meaning of all thoughts even if they do not share the creature‚Äôs language.
‚ñ∂ Obstructions: The ability to perceive thoughts is obstructed by a thin layer of lead or by rock of 2‚Äô thick or greater.

MagicUser.Name: Invisibility
MagicUser.Duration: Permanent (but may be broken, see below)
MagicUser.Description:
The caster or another creature or object within range becomes invisible:
‚ñ∂ If cast on a creature: Any gear the subject is carrying is also rendered invisible (this includes clothing and armour). Items dropped or put down by an invisible creature become visible. If the subject attacks or casts a spell, the invisibility is broken, ending the spell.
‚ñ∂ If cast on an object: The invisibility is permanent.
‚ñ∂ Light sources: If a light source is made invisible (either as part of a creature‚Äôs gear or as an individual object), the light it casts is unaffected.

MagicUser.Name: Knock
MagicUser.Description:
The knock spell opens stuck, barred, or locked doors, gates, chests, and so forth.
‚ñ∂ Magically held doors: Are affected (e.g. hold portal, wizard lock).
‚ñ∂ Secret doors: May be opened, but they must be known to the caster.

MagicUser.Name: Levitate
MagicUser.Description:
This enchantment allows the caster to move up and down through the air:
‚ñ∂ Vertical: The caster mentally directs vertical movement at up to 20‚Äô per round.
‚ñ∂ Horizontal: The caster can push against solid objects to move laterally.
‚ñ∂ Weight: A normal amount of weight can be carried while levitating.

MagicUser.Name: Locate Object
MagicUser.Description:
The caster can sense the direction (but not distance) of an object. One of two types of objects may be located:
1. General class: An object of a general class (e.g. a stairway, an altar, etc.). In this case, the nearest object of that type is located.
2. Specific object: A specific object known to the caster.
Restrictions: This spell cannot be used to locate creatures.

MagicUser.Name: Mirror Image
MagicUser.Description:
1d4 illusory duplicates of the caster appear.
‚ñ∂ Behaviour: The mirror images look and behave exactly as the caster.
‚ñ∂ Attacks on the caster: Destroy one of the mirror images (even if the attack misses).

MagicUser.Name: Phantasmal Force
MagicUser.Description:
A visual illusion of the caster‚Äôs choosing manifests in a 20‚Äô cube area. Three types of illusions may be created:
1. An illusionary monster: That can be directed to attack. The monster has an Armour Class of 9 [10] and will vanish if hit in combat.
2. An illusionary attack: For example, an avalanche, a falling ceiling, a magic missile, etc. Targets who save versus spells are unaffected.
3. A scene: Either changing the appearance of the affected area or creating the appearance of something new. The scene disappears if touched.
Stipulations: The following apply:
‚ñ∂ Concentration: Is required to maintain the illusion. If the caster moves or loses concentration, the spell ends.
‚ñ∂ Illusionary monsters or attacks: May appear to be harmful but no real damage is ever inflicted. A character who appears to die actually falls unconscious, a character turned to stone will actually be paralysed, and so on. Such effects last for 1d4 turns.
‚ñ∂ Illusions from imagination: If the illusion is of something the caster has not personally seen, the referee should grant targets a bonus to any applicable saving throws.

MagicUser.Name: Web
MagicUser.Description:
Web conjures a many-layered mass of strong, sticky threads, blocking a 10‚Äô cube area.
‚ñ∂ Entanglement: Creatures caught within a web become entangled among the gluey fibres. Entangled creatures can‚Äôt move, but can break free depending on their strength.
‚ñ∂ Flammable: The strands of the web are flammable and can be destroyed by fire in two rounds. All creatures caught within flaming webs suffer 1d6 points of damage from the flames.
Breaking free: Depends on STR:
‚ñ∂ Normal human range: The creature can break free in 2d4 turns.
‚ñ∂ Magically augmented STR above 18: The creature can break free in 4 rounds.
‚ñ∂ Giant strength: The creature can break free in two rounds.

MagicUser.Name: Wizard Lock
MagicUser.Description:
A wizard lock spell magically locks a door, gate, similar portal, or any item that has a lock.
Bypassing: The magical lock is permanent but may be bypassed as follows:
‚ñ∂ The caster: Can freely pass their own wizard lock.
‚ñ∂ A knock spell: Allows passage.
‚ñ∂ Higher level casters: Any magic-using character who is at least 3 levels higher than the caster of the wizard lock may pass through unimpeded.
Temporary: Bypassing does not destroy a wizard lock.

MagicUser.Name: Clairvoyance
MagicUser.Description:
The caster gains the ability to see through the eyes of other living creatures.
‚ñ∂ Focus for 1 turn: To establish a connection with a creature, the caster must focus their concentration in one particular direction for one turn.
‚ñ∂ After this turn: The visual perceptions of one creature within range in that direction are relayed to the caster.
‚ñ∂ Switching: Once a connection is established, the caster may choose to maintain it or to change to another subject.
‚ñ∂ Obstructions: The spell is blocked by a thin layer of lead or by rock of 2‚Äô thick or greater.

MagicUser.Name: Dispel Magic
MagicUser.Description:
Dispel magic ends spell effects within a 20‚Äô cube area.
‚ñ∂ Caster levels: If the level of the caster of the effect to be dispelled is higher than the level of the caster of dispel magic, there is a 5% chance per level difference that the attempt to dispel will fail.
‚ñ∂ Magic items: Are unaffected.

MagicUser.Name: Fire Ball
MagicUser.Description:
Flame streaks towards a point within range and detonates in a 20‚Äô radius sphere.
‚ñ∂ Damage: Creatures caught in the fire ball suffer 1d6 damage per level of the caster, with a successful save versus spells indicating half damage.

MagicUser.Name: Fly
MagicUser.Range: The caster or a creature touched
MagicUser.Description:
The subject gains the ability to fly through the air.
‚ñ∂ Movement rate: Up to 360‚Äô (120‚Äô).
‚ñ∂ Free movement: Is possible in any direction, including the ability to levitate and to hover in mid-air.

MagicUser.Name: Haste
MagicUser.Description:
Up to 24 creatures in a 60‚Äô diameter area are enchanted to be able to move and act twice as quickly as normal:
‚ñ∂ Movement: Subjects‚Äô maximum movement rates are doubled.
‚ñ∂ Attacks: Subjects may make double the normal number of attacks per round.
‚ñ∂ Spells: The number of spells a subject may cast per round is not doubled.
‚ñ∂ Magical devices: The use of devices such as wands is also not doubled.

MagicUser.Name: Hold Person
MagicUser.Description:
This spell causes one or more humans, demihumans, or human-like monsters (see Persons under General Notes in Classic Fantasy: Monsters) to be paralysed if they fail a saving throw versus spells. It may be cast in two ways:
1. Against an individual: The target‚Äôs saving throw is penalised by ‚Äì2.
2. Against a group: 1d4 individuals in the group are targeted.
Restrictions: Undead and human-like monsters of greater than 4+1 HD (see Hit point modifiers under Game Statistics in Classic Fantasy: Monsters) are not affected.

MagicUser.Name: Infravision
MagicUser.Range: The caster or a creature touched
MagicUser.Description: The subject is able to see 60‚Äô in the dark with infravision.

MagicUser.Name: Invisibility 10‚Äô Radius
MagicUser.Duration: Permanent (but may be broken, see below)
MagicUser.Description:
A selected creature and all creatures within 10‚Äô of it become invisible:
‚ñ∂ Area: The 10‚Äô radius area of the spell‚Äôs effect moves with the chosen creature.
‚ñ∂ Exiting the area: Subjects that move more than 10‚Äô away from the chosen creature become visible.
‚ñ∂ Entering the area: Creatures that move into the area after the spell is cast do not become invisible.
‚ñ∂ Gear: Any gear a subject is carrying is also rendered invisible. Items dropped or put down by an invisible creature become visible. Carried light sources become invisible but the emitted light does not.
‚ñ∂ Breaking the invisibility: If a subject attacks or casts a spell, the invisibility is broken for that subject.

MagicUser.Name: Lightning Bolt
MagicUser.Description:
A powerful stroke of electrical energy, 60‚Äô long and 5‚Äô wide, is conjured.
‚ñ∂ Damage: Creatures caught in the lightning bolt suffer 1d6 damage per level of the caster, with a successful save versus spells indicating half damage.
‚ñ∂ Bouncing: If the lightning bolt hits a solid barrier before its full length is reached, it is reflected and travels for any remaining distance of its full length in the direction of the caster.

MagicUser.Name: Protection from Evil 10‚Äô Radius
MagicUser.Description:
This spell wards the caster and all allies within 10‚Äô from attacks by creatures of another alignment, as follows:
‚ñ∂ Bonuses: Those warded gain a +1 bonus to saving throws against attacks or special abilities of affected creatures.
‚ñ∂ Affected creatures‚Äô attacks: Against those warded are penalised by ‚Äì1.
‚ñ∂ Enchanted, constructed, or summoned creatures: The spell additionally prevents such creatures from making melee attacks against those warded, though they may still make ranged attacks. If any of the warded party engages such a creature in melee, this protection is broken (those warded still gain the save and attack bonuses mentioned above).

MagicUser.Name: Protection from Normal Missiles
MagicUser.Description: A single subject in range gains complete immunity to small, non-magical missiles (e.g. no protection is granted against hurled boulders or enchanted arrows).

MagicUser.Name: Water Breathing
MagicUser.Description:
The subject can breathe water freely by means of this spell.
‚ñ∂ Breathing air: The spell does not affect the subject‚Äôs ability to breathe air.
‚ñ∂ Swimming: No additional proficiency at swimming is granted.

MagicUser.Name: Charm Monster
MagicUser.Description:
This spell places a charm upon either 3d6 creatures of 3 HD or less or a single creature of more than 3 HD. Each subject must make a save versus spells or be charmed as follows:
‚ñ∂ Friendship: The subject regards the caster as its trusted friend and ally and will come to the caster‚Äôs defence.
‚ñ∂ Commands: If they share a language, the caster may give the charmed creature commands, which it will obey.
‚ñ∂ Subject‚Äôs nature: Commands that contradict the charmed creature‚Äôs habits or alignment may be ignored.
‚ñ∂ Suicidal commands: An affected creature never obeys suicidal or obviously harmful orders.
Restrictions: Undead are not affected.
Duration: The charm lasts indefinitely, but the subject is allowed to make further saves versus spells at intervals, depending on its INT score. If one of these saves succeeds, the spell ends.
‚ñ∂ INT 3‚Äì8: New save once every month.
‚ñ∂ INT 9‚Äì12: New save each week
‚ñ∂ INT 13‚Äì18: New save once every day.

MagicUser.Name: Confusion
MagicUser.Description:
This spell causes 3d6 subjects within 60‚Äô of one another to become confused, making them unable to independently determine what they will do.
‚ñ∂ Subjects of 2+1 HD or greater: May save versus spells each round to resist the spell‚Äôs effect, acting with free will that round if they make the save.
‚ñ∂ Subjects of 2 HD or lower: May not make a saving throw.
‚ñ∂ Behaviour: Roll on the following table separately for each affected subject each round to determine how that subject acts that round:

2d6 Behaviour
2‚Äì5 Attack caster‚Äôs group
6‚Äì8 No action
9‚Äì12 Attack subject‚Äôs group

MagicUser.Name: Dimension Door
MagicUser.Description:
The caster or a single creature is instantly transferred to another location up to 360‚Äô distant. The destination may be selected in two ways:
1. Known location: A location, within 360‚Äô, known to the caster.
2. An unknown location: Specified by a series of offsets (e.g. 120‚Äô north, 160‚Äô east, 80‚Äô up) totalling not more than 360‚Äô.
Stipulations: The following apply:
‚ñ∂ If the destination is occupied: By a solid body, the spell fails.
‚ñ∂ If the target is unwilling: It may save versus spells to resist the teleportation.

MagicUser.Name: Growth of Plants
MagicUser.Description:
This spell causes vigorous growth of normal vegetation in an area within range. Plants in the affected area become thick and overgrown, entwining to form a thorny jungle.
‚ñ∂ Area: An area of up to 3,000 square feet‚Äîselected by the caster‚Äîis affected (e.g. 150‚Äô √ó 20‚Äô, 100‚Äô √ó 30‚Äô, etc.).
‚ñ∂ Passage: Only very large creatures can force their way through.

MagicUser.Name: Hallucinatory Terrain
MagicUser.Description:
Hallucinatory terrain either conjures an illusory terrain feature (e.g. a hill, wood, marsh, etc.) or hides an existing terrain feature.
‚ñ∂ Area: The illusion must fit completely within the spell‚Äôs range.
‚ñ∂ Touching: If the illusion is touched by an intelligent being, the spell is negated.

MagicUser.Name: Massmorph
MagicUser.Description:
A force of human-sized creatures within a 240‚Äô diameter area is veiled by illusion to appear as a copse of trees or orchard.
‚ñ∂ Moving through: Once the illusion is in place, even creatures moving among the veiled subjects are deceived.
‚ñ∂ Subjects who leave the affected area: Cease to be veiled.
‚ñ∂ Dismissing: The caster may dismiss the illusion in its entirety at any time.

MagicUser.Name: Polymorph Others
MagicUser.Description:
A living subject is changed into another type of creature, as chosen by the caster:
‚ñ∂ HD: The spell fails if the new form‚Äôs HD is more than twice the subject‚Äôs HD.
‚ñ∂ Hit points: The subject retains the same number of hit points.
‚ñ∂ Abilities: The subject truly becomes the new form: all special abilities are acquired, along with behavioural patterns, tendencies, and intelligence.
‚ñ∂ Specific individuals: The spell cannot be used to duplicate a specific individual.
‚ñ∂ Reversion: If the subject dies, it returns to its original form.
‚ñ∂ An unwilling subject: May save versus spells to negate the effect.

MagicUser.Name: Polymorph Self
MagicUser.Description:
The caster transforms themselves into another being:
‚ñ∂ HD: The new form may not have higher Hit Dice than the caster‚Äôs level.
‚ñ∂ Stats: The caster retains their own intelligence, hit points, saving throws, and attack probabilities.
‚ñ∂ Physical capabilities: Of the new form (e.g. strength, physical attack forms, modes of movement) are acquired.
‚ñ∂ Non-physical special abilities: (e.g. immunities, breath weapons, spell casting) are not acquired.
‚ñ∂ Casting spells: While polymorphed, the caster is unable to cast spells.
‚ñ∂ Specific individuals: The spell cannot be used to duplicate a specific individual.
‚ñ∂ Reversion: If the caster dies while polymorphed, they return to their original form.

MagicUser.Name: Remove Curse
MagicUser.Range: The caster or a creature touched
MagicUser.Description:
Remove curse instantaneously removes one curse from a creature. It may allow a character to discard a cursed magic item.
Reversed: Curse
Places a deleterious effect upon a creature, if it fails a save versus spells.
‚ñ∂ Effects: The exact form and effects of the curse are determined by the caster.
‚ñ∂ Maximum possible effects include: A ‚Äì2 penalty to saving throws, a ‚Äì4 penalty to hit, reducing an ability score by 50%.
‚ñ∂ Multiple curses: May afflict a creature, as long as each has a different effect.
‚ñ∂ Referee judgement: The referee should judge the effects of this spell and may turn overly powerful curses back onto the caster!

MagicUser.Name: Curse
MagicUser.Range: The caster or a creature touched
MagicUser.Description:
Places a deleterious effect upon a creature, if it fails a save versus spells.
‚ñ∂ Effects: The exact form and effects of the curse are determined by the caster.
‚ñ∂ Maximum possible effects include: A ‚Äì2 penalty to saving throws, a ‚Äì4 penalty to hit, reducing an ability score by 50%.
‚ñ∂ Multiple curses: May afflict a creature, as long as each has a different effect.
‚ñ∂ Referee judgement: The referee should judge the effects of this spell and may turn overly powerful curses back onto the caster!
Reversed: Remove Curse
Remove curse instantaneously removes one curse from a creature. It may allow a character to discard a cursed magic item.

MagicUser.Name: Wall of Fire
MagicUser.Description:
An immobile, opaque curtain of shimmering, violet fire springs into existence.
‚ñ∂ Size: The wall can be any size, and may be shaped in any manner and to any dimensions the caster desires, up to 1,200 sq. ft. For example, it may be a straight wall or curved into a protective circle.
‚ñ∂ Location: The wall may not be evoked so that it appears where objects are.
‚ñ∂ Monsters with fewer than 4 HD: Cannot pass the wall of flames.
‚ñ∂ Monsters with 4 or more HD: Take 1d6 hit points of damage when they pass through the wall. The wall deals double damage to undead creatures or creatures that use cold or are accustomed to cold.
‚ñ∂ Concentration: The wall persists as long as the caster concentrates on the spell and does not move.

MagicUser.Name: Wall of Ice
MagicUser.Description:
An immobile, translucent, wall of ice springs into existence.
‚ñ∂ Size: The wall can be any size, and may be shaped in any manner and to any dimensions the caster desires, up to 1,200 sq. ft. For example, it may be a straight wall or curved into a protective circle.
‚ñ∂ Location: The wall must rest upon a solid surface and may not be evoked so that it appears where objects are.
‚ñ∂ Monsters with fewer than 4 HD: Cannot pass the wall of ice.
‚ñ∂ Monsters with 4 or more HD: Can break through the wall, but suffer 1d6 hit points of damage when doing so. The wall deals double damage to creatures that use fire or are accustomed to fire.

MagicUser.Name: Wizard Eye
MagicUser.Description:
An invisible, magical eye is conjured that allows the caster to see at a distance.
‚ñ∂ Movement: The eye can be directed to move within range at up to 120‚Äô per turn.
‚ñ∂ Seeing through the eye: By concentrating, the caster can see through the eye.
‚ñ∂ Types of vision: The magical eye grants both normal vision and infravision.
‚ñ∂ Barriers: Solid barriers block its passage, but it can pass through a hole or space as small as 1 inch in diameter.

MagicUser.Name: Animate Dead
MagicUser.Description:
This spell turns the bones or bodies of dead creatures into undead skeletons or zombies:
‚ñ∂ Obedient: They obey the caster‚Äôs commands.
‚ñ∂ Special abilities: They are unable to use any special abilities (including spell casting) that they possessed in life.
‚ñ∂ Duration: They remain animated until they are destroyed or until a dispel magic spell is cast upon them.
Number: The spell animates a number of Hit Dice of zombies or skeletons equal to the caster‚Äôs level:
‚ñ∂ Skeletons: Have AC 7 [12] and HD equal to those the creature had in life.
‚ñ∂ Zombies: Have AC 8 [11] and HD one greater than the creature had in life.
‚ñ∂ Classed characters: If a PC or NPC with levels in a class is reanimated by this spell, the levels are not counted as HD. For example, the reanimated corpse of a 5th level fighter would have 2 HD (1 HD as a normal human, +1 for being reanimated as a zombie).

MagicUser.Name: Cloudkill
MagicUser.Description:
A poisonous fog streams from the caster‚Äôs fingertips, filling a 30‚Äô diameter area.
‚ñ∂ Movement: The fog moves at 60‚Äô per turn (20‚Äô per round), driven by the wind (or away from the caster, in still conditions).
‚ñ∂ Sinking: Because the fog is heavier than air, it sinks to the lowest level of the land, even pouring down den or sinkhole openings.
‚ñ∂ Damage: All creatures in contact with the vapours suffer 1 hit point of damage per round of contact.
‚ñ∂ Creatures with less than 5 Hit Dice: Must also save versus death (once per round of contact) or die.

MagicUser.Name: Conjure Elemental
MagicUser.Description:
A 16 Hit Dice elemental‚Äîa being formed of pure elemental matter‚Äîis summoned from an elemental plane of the caster‚Äôs choice (air, earth, fire, water) to do the caster‚Äôs bidding.
‚ñ∂ Materials: The summons requires a large volume of the appropriate element.
‚ñ∂ Concentration: Is required to command an elemental.
‚ñ∂ Dismissing: While control over the elemental is maintained, the caster may dismiss it at any time, sending it back to its plane of origin.
‚ñ∂ Disruption: If the caster moves at more than half speed or their concentration is disturbed, the command over the elemental ends. It is, henceforth, a free-willed entity and will immediately try to kill the caster and any who get in its way.
‚ñ∂ Dispelling: A conjured elemental may be dispelled by dispel magic or dispel evil.
Restrictions: The caster may summon at most one elemental from each plane in a single day.
Refer to 'Air Elemental', 'Earth Elemental', 'Fire Elemental', and 'Water Elemental' stat blocks in the Monsters section for full details.

MagicUser.Name: Contact Higher Plane
MagicUser.Description:
A channel of communication is opened to a higher plane of existence, allowing the caster to ask powerful, otherworldly beings for advice and knowledge on any subject.
‚ñ∂ Plane: The caster must choose which plane of existence to contact: communion with beings of the 3rd to 12th planes is possible via this spell. Higher numbered planes are home to more powerful and knowledgeable beings.
‚ñ∂ Questions: The caster may then ask a number of simple yes/no questions equal to the number of the plane contacted. The referee plays the role of the contacted being, responding to the caster‚Äôs questions.
‚ñ∂ Answers: For each question asked, there is a chance of the contacted being not knowing the answer or of answering untruthfully: see the table to the right. It is impossible to detect whether the entity is lying.
Restrictions: Casting contact higher plane is a great and perilous deed.
‚ñ∂ Usage limit: It may be cast at most once per week. (The referee may limit the spell‚Äôs usage to even less frequently, if desired.)
‚ñ∂ Insanity: Communion with otherworldly beings of great power can shatter the caster‚Äôs sanity. The basic chance is shown in the table above. For every level of the caster above 11, this chance is reduced by 5%. If the caster is driven insane as a result of the communion, the recovery time is a number of weeks equal to the number of the plane contacted.

MagicUser.Name: Feeblemind
MagicUser.Description: An arcane spell caster (e.g. a magic-user or elf) within range must save versus spells (at a ‚Äì4 penalty) or become an imbecile, unable to think clearly or cast spells.

MagicUser.Name: Hold Monster
MagicUser.Description:
This spell causes one or more creatures to be paralysed if they fail a saving throw versus spells. It may be cast in two ways:
1. Against an individual: The target‚Äôs saving throw is penalised by ‚Äì2.
2. Against a group: 1d4 individuals in the group are targeted.
Restrictions: Undead are not affected.

MagicUser.Name: Magic Jar
MagicUser.Description:
The caster‚Äôs body enters a comatose trance as their life-force is transferred into a receptacle (any inanimate object within 30‚Äô), known as a magic jar. From there, the caster may attempt to possess the bodies of other creatures.
When the caster‚Äôs life-force is in the magic jar:
‚ñ∂ Possession: The caster may attempt to possess the body of another creature within 120‚Äô. The victim may save versus spells to resist possession. If the save is successful, the caster may not make another attempt to possess that victim for one turn. If the save fails, the caster‚Äôs life-force leaves the magic jar and enters the victim, possessing it.
‚ñ∂ Returning: The caster may choose to return to their own body at any time, ending the spell.
‚ñ∂ If the magic jar is destroyed: The caster dies.
‚ñ∂ If the caster‚Äôs own body is destroyed: Their life-force is stranded in the magic jar.
When the caster‚Äôs life-force is possessing a victim:
‚ñ∂ Control: The caster gains full control over the victim‚Äôs body, but is not able to make the victim cast spells.
‚ñ∂ If the magic jar is destroyed: The spell ends and the caster‚Äôs life-force is trapped in the possessed body.
‚ñ∂ If the possessed victim is killed: The caster‚Äôs life-force returns to the magic jar.
‚ñ∂ Dispelling: Dispel evil forces the caster‚Äôs life-force back into the magic jar.
‚ñ∂ If the caster‚Äôs own body is destroyed: Their life-force is stranded in the body of the creature being possessed.

MagicUser.Name: Pass-Wall
MagicUser.Description: A 5‚Äô diameter hole is temporarily opened in solid rock or stone, forming a passageway up to 10‚Äô deep.

MagicUser.Name: Telekinesis
MagicUser.Description:
By concentrating, the caster is able to move objects or creatures by the power of thought.
‚ñ∂ Weight: Up to 200 coins of weight per level of the caster may be targeted.
‚ñ∂ Movement: The target may be moved up to 20‚Äô per round, in whatever direction the caster wishes (including vertically).
‚ñ∂ Save: If a creature is targeted, it may save versus spells to resist the spell.
‚ñ∂ Concentration: If the caster‚Äôs concentration is broken, the target will fall.

MagicUser.Name: Teleport
MagicUser.Description:
The caster or a chosen creature vanishes and reappears at a location of the caster‚Äôs choosing.
‚ñ∂ Gear: The subject is teleported with all its gear, up to its maximum load.
‚ñ∂ Unwilling subjects: May save versus spells to prevent the teleportation.
‚ñ∂ Destination: May be at any distance, but must be known to the caster. The destination must be an open space at ground level. (It is not possible to intentionally teleport the subject into mid-air or into solid matter.)
‚ñ∂ Risk: There is a risk, when teleporting, of accidentally arriving above or below ground level. The chance of a successful teleportation depends on the caster‚Äôs knowledge of the destination (see right). Roll d% and consult the table below.
Teleport Result Table:

Ground level: The subject appears at the desired destination.
Too high: The subject appears 1d10√ó10‚Äô above the intended destination. Should this location already be occupied by solid matter, the subject is instantly killed. Otherwise, the subject falls from a height.

‚ñ∂ Scant: A location that the caster has visited once or twice, has seen by magical scrying, or has heard of from descriptions.
‚ñ∂ Moderate: A location that the caster has visited often or has studied via scrying for several weeks.
‚ñ∂ Exact: A location that the caster has made a detailed study of, in person.

MagicUser.Name: Transmute Rock to Mud
MagicUser.Description:
This spell turns up to 3,000 square feet of rock into 10‚Äô deep mud.
‚ñ∂ Movement: Any creatures passing through the mud have their movement rate reduced by 90%.
Reversed: Transmute Mud to Rock
Changes an area of mud‚Äîup to 3,000 square feet and up to 10‚Äô deep‚Äîinto rock. This alteration is permanent.

MagicUser.Name: Transmute Mud to Rock
MagicUser.Description:
Changes an area of mud‚Äîup to 3,000 square feet and up to 10‚Äô deep‚Äîinto rock. This alteration is permanent.
Reversed: Transmute Rock to Mud
This spell turns up to 3,000 square feet of rock into 10‚Äô deep mud.
‚ñ∂ Movement: Any creatures passing through the mud have their movement rate reduced by 90%.

MagicUser.Name: Wall of Stone
MagicUser.Description:
A wall of solid rock appears.
‚ñ∂ Size: The wall may be of whatever shape the caster desires and is of 1,000 cubic feet in volume. (For example, a 2‚Äô thick wall, 50‚Äô long and 10‚Äô high.)
‚ñ∂ Location: The wall must rest upon a solid surface and may not be evoked so that it appears where objects are.

MagicUser.Name: Anti-Magic Shell
MagicUser.Description:
An anti-magic barrier is created around the caster.
‚ñ∂ Blocks magic: No spells or spell effects can pass through this barrier, whether from inside or outside.
‚ñ∂ Dismissing: The caster may end this spell at any time before the duration has expired.

MagicUser.Name: Control Weather
MagicUser.Description:
By concentrating (no movement allowed), the caster causes one of the following conditions to manifest around themselves. This spell only functions outdoors.
‚ñ∂ Calm: Clears bad weather (though side-effects‚Äîe.g. mud after rain‚Äîremain.)
‚ñ∂ Extreme heat: Dries up snow or mud (including transmute rock to mud). Creatures in the area move at half normal rate.
‚ñ∂ Fog: Visibility drops to 20‚Äô. Creatures in the fog move at half their normal rate. At the referee‚Äôs option, they may also have a chance of getting lost.
‚ñ∂ High winds: Movement rates are halved. Missile fire and flight are impossible. High winds may be used to increase the sailing speed of ships by 50%, if they travel with the wind. In sandy areas, may cause a sandstorm, reducing visibility to 20‚Äô.
‚ñ∂ Rain: ‚Äì2 penalty to missile attacks. Mud forms in 3 turns, halving movement rates.
‚ñ∂ Snow: Visibility drops to 20‚Äô. Movement rates are halved. Bodies of water may freeze. After the snow thaws, mud remains and still impedes movement.
‚ñ∂ Tornado: The caster can direct the tornado, which moves at 120‚Äô per round. The tornado can be directed to attack (see 'Tornado' stat block in the Monsters section for full details). Ships caught in a tornado have a 75% chance of suffering 12 points of hull damage.

MagicUser.Name: Death Spell
MagicUser.Description:
Up to 4d8 Hit Dice of creatures within a 60‚Äô cube area must save versus death or die, instantly.
Restrictions: Undead and creatures with greater than 7 Hit Dice are unaffected.

MagicUser.Name: Disintegrate
MagicUser.Description:
The material form of a single, non-magical creature or object is instantly and permanently destroyed.
‚ñ∂ If a creature is targeted: It may save versus death to resist disintegration.
‚ñ∂ Examples of objects: The following might be targeted: a tree, a ship, a 10‚Äô section of wall.

MagicUser.Name: Geas
MagicUser.Description:
The caster commands a subject to perform or avoid performing a specific action.
‚ñ∂ Examples: Bringing a specific item to the caster, eating or drinking without restraint, keeping a certain fact secret.
‚ñ∂ Impossible or deadly tasks: The prescribed geas must not be obviously suicidal or directly deadly‚Äîif such a geas is cast, it affects the caster, instead.
‚ñ∂ Saving throw: The subject may save versus spells, to avoid coming under the spell‚Äôs effect.
‚ñ∂ If the save fails: The subject must follow the stipulated course of action or suffer gradually increasing (and eventually fatal) penalties determined by the referee (e.g. penalties to attack, ability score reductions, inability to memorize spells, physical torment and feebleness, etc.).

MagicUser.Name: Remove Geas
MagicUser.Description:
Can dispel an active geas spell and any incurred penalties. If the caster of the geas to be nullified is higher level than the character casting remove geas, there is a chance of the spell having no effect. The probability of spell failure is 5% per level the caster is below the caster of geas.
Reversed: Geas
The caster commands a subject to perform or avoid performing a specific action.
‚ñ∂ Examples: Bringing a specific item to the caster, eating or drinking without restraint, keeping a certain fact secret.
‚ñ∂ Impossible or deadly tasks: The prescribed geas must not be obviously suicidal or directly deadly‚Äîif such a geas is cast, it affects the caster, instead.
‚ñ∂ Saving throw: The subject may save versus spells, to avoid coming under the spell‚Äôs effect.
‚ñ∂ If the save fails: The subject must follow the stipulated course of action or suffer gradually increasing (and eventually fatal) penalties determined by the referee (e.g. penalties to attack, ability score reductions, inability to memorize spells, physical torment and feebleness, etc.).

MagicUser.Name: Invisible Stalker
MagicUser.Description:
An invisible stalker (see 'Invisible Stalker' stat block in the Monsters section for full details) is summoned to the caster‚Äôs presence and magically bound to perform a mission of the caster‚Äôs choosing.
‚ñ∂ Wording: The caster must be careful with the wording of the mission. Invisible stalkers are treacherous and, unless the assigned mission can be easily and quickly accomplished, will follow the letter of the command while twisting the intent.
‚ñ∂ Duration: The creature is bound to attempt the mission until it succeeds or is destroyed.
‚ñ∂ Banishing: The spell dispel evil will banish an invisible stalker, ending the spell.

MagicUser.Name: Lower Water
MagicUser.Description: This spell reduces the depth of a body of water by half for the duration. An area of up to 10,000 square feet may be affected.

MagicUser.Name: Move Earth
MagicUser.Description:
Earth (but not stone) within range is rearranged as the caster wishes.
‚ñ∂ Movement rate: The caster can move earth in the area at up to 60‚Äô per turn.
‚ñ∂ Excavations: The range of the spell also extends downwards, allowing excavations to be made.

MagicUser.Name: Part Water
MagicUser.Description: The caster creates a path 10‚Äô wide and a maximum of 120‚Äô long through water, such as a pond, lake, or other body. The caster can dismiss the spell‚Äôs effect before the duration ends.

MagicUser.Name: Projected Image
MagicUser.Description:
An illusory duplicate of the caster appears within range.
‚ñ∂ Duplicate: The image is an exact duplicate of the caster that can only be differentiated by touch.
‚ñ∂ Subsequent spells cast: Appear to originate from the image. (Targets must still be visible to the caster, however.)
‚ñ∂ Spells and missiles: The image appears unaffected by spells or missile weapons.
‚ñ∂ Melee or touch: If the image is touched or hit in melee, it disappears.

MagicUser.Name: Reincarnation
MagicUser.Description:
A dead character is returned to life in a new physical form that manifests in the presence of the caster. The character‚Äôs new body is not necessarily the same as the original; it is determined by rolling on the Reincarnated Class table. The roll indicates either a character class or a monster:
‚ñ∂ Character class: The character is of experience level 1d6 (or at most the same level as the character achieved before death). The reincarnated character can continue to gain experience and advance as normal, in the new class.
‚ñ∂ Monster: The type should be determined by the referee. The monster should be at least partially intelligent, have no greater Hit Dice than the level of the character being reincarnated (at most 6 HD), and be of the same alignment. The Reincarnation: Lawful Monsters, Reincarnation: Neutral Monsters, and Reincarnation: Chaotic Monsters tables may be used, or the referee may create their own tables. Monsters cannot gain experience or advance in level.

MagicUser.Name: Stone to Flesh
MagicUser.Description: This spell transforms stone into living flesh. It is especially useful for restoring life to a petrified creature and its equipment to its normal state.

MagicUser.Name: Flesh to Stone
MagicUser.Description: Turns one creature into a statue, including all gear and any items currently held. A saving throw versus paralysis is permitted to resist the transformation.

Druid.Name: Animal Friendship
Druid.Description:
The caster approaches a neutral-aligned beast of animal intelligence with a piece of food that it finds attractive. The animal must save versus spells:
‚ñ∂ If the save succeeds: The animal is not affected by the magic and behaves normally.
‚ñ∂ If the save fails: The animal waits quietly while the caster performs a binding ritual lasting 6 turns.
Once the binding is complete: The animal behaves as follows:
‚ñ∂ Follow: It will follow the caster wherever they go.
‚ñ∂ Leaving the animal: The animal will not harm the caster, but if it is left alone for more than three days during the first three months, it reverts to its natural behaviour, ending the spell.
‚ñ∂ Training: During the first three months, the animal may be trained to perform up to six simple tricks (depending on its intelligence). Each trick takes one week to train.
Maximum animal companions: Up to 2HD of animals per level of the caster may be befriended by this spell at any one time.

Druid.Name: Detect Danger
Druid.Description:
The caster can concentrate to detect dangers within range.
‚ñ∂ Areas: Scanning a 10‚Äô √ó 10‚Äô area takes one turn.
‚ñ∂ Creatures: Scanning a creature takes one round.
‚ñ∂ Objects: Scanning a small object (e.g. a chest, weapon, etc.) takes one round. Larger objects take longer.
After scanning: The caster knows whether the area, creature, or object poses a danger to their person. This knowledge distinguishes between immediate dangers and potential dangers.

Druid.Name: Entangle
Druid.Description:
All plants present in a 20‚Äô radius area within range bend and twist, entangling creatures inside the area.
‚ñ∂ Saving throw: Each creature in the affected area may save versus spells.
‚ñ∂ If the save fails: The creature is entangled and cannot move.
‚ñ∂ If the save succeeds: The creature is able to move through the entangled area at half its normal movement rate.

Druid.Name: Faerie Fire
Druid.Description:
Selected objects or creatures in range are outlined with a lambent, green fire.
‚ñ∂ Targets: The caster must be able to perceive or detect the targets.
‚ñ∂ Size of targets: If the caster is below 5th level, a single object or creature of approximately human size (or smaller) can be affected. At 5th level, two human-sized targets or one target up to 10‚Äô tall can be affected. At 10th level, three human-sized targets or one target up to 15‚Äô tall can be affected. At 14th level, four human-sized targets or one target up to 20‚Äô tall can be affected.
‚ñ∂ Harmless: The faerie fire does not cause damage.
‚ñ∂ Counters invisibility: The flickering fire makes invisible targets visible.
‚ñ∂ In low light conditions: Attacks on targets gain a +2 bonus to hit.

Druid.Name: Invisibility to Animals
Druid.Range: The caster or a creature touched
Druid.Description: This spell renders the subject undetectable to all senses (smell, sight, hearing) of non-magical animals and able to wander among them completely unnoticed.

Druid.Name: Locate Plant or Animal
Druid.Description:
The caster can sense the direction (but not distance) of a non-magical, non-sentient plant or animal of a chosen type. The spell has two uses:
1. Named species: Locating a plant or animal of a named species. In this case, the nearest plant or animal of that species is located.
2. Individual: Locating a specific plant or animal which the caster can clearly visualise in all aspects.

Druid.Name: Predict Weather
Druid.Description: The caster gains accurate knowledge of the weather within range over the next 12 hours.

Druid.Name: Speak with Animals
Druid.Description:
The caster can communicate with one type of animal within range when the spell is cast.
‚ñ∂ Type of animal: Ordinary animals or giant versions of ordinary animals may be targeted.
‚ñ∂ Questions: The caster can ask questions of and receive answers from animals of the chosen kind, although the spell doesn‚Äôt make animals any more friendly or cooperative than normal (a reaction roll may be required).
‚ñ∂ Services: If an animal is friendly toward the caster, it may perform some favour or service.

Druid.Description:
The subject‚Äôs skin toughens like bark.
‚ñ∂ AC bonus: The subject‚Äôs Armour Class improves by 1.
‚ñ∂ Save bonus: The subject gains a +1 bonus to all saving throws except against magical effects.

Druid.Description:
This spell causes a magical spring to gush forth from the ground.
‚ñ∂ Volume: The fount produces approximately 50 gallons of water‚Äîenough to sustain twelve humans and twelve mounts for one day.
‚ñ∂ Higher level casters: If the caster is higher than 8th level, water sufficient for an additional twelve humans and mounts is produced for each level beyond 8th.

Druid.Name: Cure Light Wounds
Druid.Range: The caster or a creature touched
Druid.Description:
This spell has two uses

Druid.Name: Cause Light Wounds
Druid.Range: The caster or a creature touched
Druid.Description:
Inflicts 1d6+1 hit points of damage to a touched creature. In combat, a melee attack roll is required.
Reversed: Cure Light Wounds
This spell has two uses
1. Healing a living subject: Restores 1d6+1 hit points of damage. This cannot grant more hit points than the subject‚Äôs normal maximum.
2. Curing paralysis: Paralysing effects are negated.

Druid.Name: Heat Metal

All metal in the possession of a number of human-sized subjects is heated to extreme temperatures.
‚ñ∂ Number of subjects: One per two experience levels of the caster.
‚ñ∂ The heat produced: Increases for four rounds, then fades (see the table below).

Hand or foot: unusable for 2d4 days. Body: severely weakened for 1d4 days (movement rate halved, unable to fight, cast spells, or perform any strenuous activity). Head: unconscious for 1d4 turns.)

Round 6: Blistering (1d3 damage)

Druid.Name: Obscuring Mist

A cloud of misty vapour emanates from the ground, filling an area centred on the caster.
‚ñ∂ Height: The mist is 10‚Äô high.
‚ñ∂ Vision: The mist blocks normal vision and infravision. Creatures that can see invisible things can see faintly through the mist.

‚ñ∂ Throwing the flame: The caster may drop the flame or throw it up to 30‚Äô. This ends the spell (though fires started by the magical flame may persist).

Druid.Name: Slow Poison

Druid.Description:

‚ñ∂ Poison effects: As long as the subject has more than 1 hit point, the slowed poison inflicts 1hp of damage per turn. If the subject is at 1hp, the poison inflicts no further damage.

‚ñ∂ When the duration ends: The full effects of the poison occur. If the subject was revived from death by this spell, they die once more.

‚ñ∂ Magic weapons and arms: Have a 10% chance of being unaffected per magical ‚Äúplus‚Äù. (e.g. a magical spear +2 has a 20% chance of being unaffected by warp wood.)

‚ñ∂ Storm clouds: Must be present in the sky above the point to be struck by lightning.
‚ñ∂ Number of strikes: One lightning strike may be summoned per turn of the spell‚Äôs duration.
‚ñ∂ Area: A lightning strike affects a 10‚Äô radius area.
‚ñ∂ Damage: All creatures in the area suffer 8d6 damage (save versus spells for half damage).
‚ñ∂ If the storm dissipates: The spell ends prematurely.

2. Plant growth: Causing vigorous growth of normal vegetation.
When used to affect an animal:
‚ñ∂ Strength: The animal‚Äôs strength is doubled, along with the damage inflicted by its attacks and the amount of weight it can carry.
‚ñ∂ Restrictions: This spell may be used on giant versions of normal animals, but intelligent animals and fantastic monsters are unaffected.
When used to affect plants:
‚ñ∂ Area: Plants in an area within range of up to 3,000 square feet are affected. The area is selected by the caster (e.g. 150‚Äô √ó 20‚Äô, 100‚Äô √ó 30‚Äô, etc.).

This spell causes one or more animals to be paralysed if they fail a saving throw versus spells.
‚ñ∂ Number of targets: Up to 1 Hit Die of animals per level of the caster may be targeted.
‚ñ∂ Restrictions: Normal or giant animals may be affected. Fantastic creatures, intelligent animals, or magically conjured, controlled, or summoned animals cannot be affected.

Druid.Name: Protection from Poison

Druid.Description:
The subject gains a supernatural resistance to poisons.
‚ñ∂ Venoms and gases: Complete immunity is granted against venomous attacks of monsters (e.g. bites) and poisonous gases (including those conjured by magic).
‚ñ∂ Breath attacks: The subject gains a +4 bonus to saving throws against poisonous breath weapons. (This does not include petrifying breath attacks.)
‚ñ∂ Pre-existing poisons: Any poisons that are actively affecting the subject when protection from poison is cast are neutralized. A character who has died from poisoning can be revived if this spell is cast within ten rounds.

Druid.Name: Tree Shape
Druid.Description:
The caster takes on the form of a living or dead tree.
‚ñ∂ Appearance: The tree form is completely realistic, even to very close inspection.
‚ñ∂ Gear: All of the caster‚Äôs clothing and equipment is also transformed.
‚ñ∂ Perception: While in this form, the caster can perceive the surroundings with their normal senses.
‚ñ∂ Cancelling: The caster may end the spell at will, returning to their normal form.

Druid.Name: Water Breathing
Druid.Description:
The subject can breathe water freely by means of this spell.
‚ñ∂ Breathing air: The spell does not affect the subject‚Äôs ability to breathe air.
‚ñ∂ Swimming: No additional proficiency at swimming is granted.
